chapter.title: Scope
chapter.para: This document defines the ONVIF file format for exported media. The specification defines the mechanism necessary to support interoperable verification of the authenticity by the receiving party.

listitem.para: A certificate as used in this specification binds a public key to a subject entity. The certificate is digitally signed by the certificate issuer to allow for verifying its authenticity
A digital signature or digital signature scheme is a mathematical scheme for demonstrating the authenticity of a digital message or document.

section.title: General
section.para: This specification defines the mandatory and complete mapping rules for converting WSDL (Web Services Description Language) service definitions into MCP tool descriptors.

section.title: Purpose and scope
section.para: This specification covers the conversion of WSDL service definitions to MCP tool descriptors, including:

listitem.para: MCP tool structure and required fields
Operation discovery from WSDL portType definitions
Input/output message mapping to JSON Schema

section.title: Mapping
section.para: The SurveillanceExportBox is required. It is recommended that the SurveillanceExportBox be placed as early as possible in files, for maximum utility.
In order to be able to associate the recording with a camera/microphone and the exporting system the following information shall be placed in the box:
entry_count is an integer that provides the number of tracks.

chapter.title: XSD to JSON Schema Type Mapping Specification

section.title: Purpose and scope
section.para: This specification defines the mandatory and complete mapping rules for converting XML Schema Definition (XSD) types into JSON Schema (Draft 7) type definitions.
